alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Mayes; Muskogee; Wagoner (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 7:38PM CST by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Mayes, southeastern Wagoner, northwestern Cherokee and northeastern Muskogee Counties through 830 PM CST... At 738 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 4 miles northeast of Wagoner to 3 miles south of Tullahassee. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Muskogee... Wagoner... Fort Gibson... Okay... Hulbert... Tullahassee... Peggs... Rose... Sequoyah State Park... Lost City... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 1000 PM CST for northeastern and east central Oklahoma.
